tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock or poultry to prevent disease spread.
subtasks: Identify designated secure entry points on the farm or ranch.
Contact the farmer or rancher for entrance procedures before arriving.
Clean trucks and trailers if mud or manure is present, as per farm requirements.
Fill out logbook or provide contact information as requested by the facility.
Follow designated routes provided by the farm or ranch.
Examine required paperwork such as CVI, brand inspection, bill of lading, and bill of sale.
Inspect animals being loaded for sickness or injury; do not load ill animals.
Confirm cleanouts are closed on trailers before loading.
Ensure proper bedding is present before loading animals.
Double-check paperwork and ensure all gates are closed after loading.
Log departure time and any other required information.

tasks.task: Adhere to biosecurity practices upon arrival at a new farm or ranch.
subtasks: Call to gain admittance as per the farm’s procedures.
Follow designated routes shown by the farmer or rancher.
On arrival, sign in if necessary and provide required information.
Examine paperwork (CVI, brand inspection, etc.) with the producer.
Verify and document numbers and classes of animals unloaded.
Separate sick animals immediately upon unloading.
After unloading, clean and disinfect transport equipment if possible; otherwise, thoroughly clean it afterward to prevent contamination.

tasks.task: Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock or poultry to prevent disease spread.
subtasks: Identify designated secure entry points on the farm or ranch.
Contact the farmer or rancher to get entrance procedures before arriving.
Clean trucks and trailers if they are dirty (with mud or manure) as per the farm’s requirements.
Fill out logbooks or provide contact information as requested by the farm.
Follow the specific routes indicated by the farmer or rancher on the premises.
Be prepared for inspection of the vehicle by the farmer or rancher before entry.
If the vehicle is dirty, clean it thoroughly or go to cleaning facilities (outside the premises) provided.
Call the farmer or rancher to gain admittance after arrival.
Follow designated routes provided by the farmer or rancher.
Sign in or provide the required contact information if needed.
Examine the necessary paperwork (like CVI, brand inspection, bill of lading, etc.) with the producer.
Inspect the livestock being unloaded for any signs of illness or injury. Do not unload sick animals and work with the producer to handle them.
Confirm the number and classes of animals unloaded with the producer, verify identification if applicable.
After unloading, move the transport equipment to a cleaning area if available, otherwise clean thoroughly as soon as possible to prevent spreading diseases.

Enter a farm premises with livestock transport while adhering to biosecurity protocols.
subtasks: Enter the premises through the designated secure entrance.
Contact the farm staff to get entrance procedures and any specific requirements.
Inspect and clean the vehicle if necessary (e.g., removing mud or manure) before entering.
Sign in/logging upon entry, provide contact information, and confirm the condition of the vehicle.
Follow the specified route provided by the farm staff.
Examine the required paperwork (e.g., CVI, brand inspection) with the farmer or rancher.
Inspect and unload animals according to the stated conditions; do not unload sick animals.
Confirm the count and classes of animals unloaded and document with the farmer.
After unloading, move the transport equipment to a cleaning area if available, or clean it properly.

tasks.task: Exit the farm premises after livestock transport while maintaining biosecurity.
subtasks: Depart the premises by following the exit route provided by the farmer or rancher.
Sign out/logging upon departure and provide any required information.
Examine the required paperwork with the farmer again before leaving.
Confirm the count and classes of animals transported.
Drive the unloaded and potentially cleaned transport equipment directly to a cleaning area or return it to storage without immediate clean-up if possible.

tasks.task: Transport livestock with biosecurity to prevent disease spread.
MAINTASK: Enter a new farm premises with livestock load while maintaining biosecurity.
subtasks: Approach the designated secure entrance for empty trucks.
Contact the farmer/rancher for entrance procedures (phone number, sign-in).
Ensure vehicle is clean or use designated facilities if dirty.
Undergo vehicle inspection by farm staff.
Fill out log or provide necessary information.
Follow the specified route provided by the farm.
Examine required paperwork with the farmer or rancher.
Inspect animals being loaded for health; exclude sick/injured.
Confirm proper loading counts and documentations.
Sign out upon departure with the correct information.

Follow biosecurity guidelines when transporting livestock or poultry to prevent disease spread.
subtasks: Identify designated secure entry points on the farm or ranch.
Contact the farmer or rancher for entrance procedures before arrival.
Clean trucks and trailers if dirty (mud or manure) as per farm requirements.
Fill out logbooks or provide contact information upon entry.
Follow designated routes provided by the farmer or rancher.
Inspect and examine required paperwork with the farmer upon arrival (e.g., CVI, brand inspection, bill of lading).
Inspect animals for signs of illness or injury; do not unload sick or injured animals.
Confirm cleanouts are closed on trailers before loading animals.
Ensure proper bedding is present on the trailer.
Double-check paperwork and ensure all gates are closed after loading.
Log departure time and other required information.

tasks.task: Adhere to biosecurity practices upon arrival at a new farm or ranch.
subtasks: Call the farmer or rancher to gain admittance after arrival.
Follow designated routes provided by the farmer or rancher.
Sign in or provide contact information as required.
Examine required paperwork with the producer (e.g., CVI, bill of lading).
Inspect and verify the number and classes of unloaded animals.
Work with the producer to isolate sick animals immediately upon unloading.
After unloading, clean and disinfect the transport equipment if possible or plan to do so upon returning to your premises.
